newsitem.title: USA: Cleveland estimates new stadium's cost at $243 mln.
newsitem.headline: Cleveland estimates new stadium's cost at $243 mln.

text.p: The cost of a new 72,000-seat football stadium for Cleveland was estimated at about $242.8 million, just under the $250 million price-tag that was agreed, according to the project manager.
The new stadium is being paid for by the City of Cleveland, the National Football League, Cleveland Tomorrow, and the State of Ohio.

"I am pleased that we are within budget amd also carrying a responsible level of contingency as we move forward in this project," said Mayor Michael White, in prepared remarks that were released on Friday.
The owners representative, Jim Conrath, explained that the stadium's cost will be further fixed as the project evolves, calling the $242.8 million total an "initial gross estimate."
"This includes hard construction costs, soft costs, such as consultant fees and a seven-percent contingency," he added, in prepared remarks.
